page.title: 19Birds of Grafham Water.
page.content: The two main{breeding wildfowl}are the Mallard and the Tufted Duck. Other regular breeders include Mute Swan, Shelduck, Shoveler, Moorhen and Coot. Amongst the{waders,}the Ringed and the Little Ringed Plover, Redshank and Lapwing all frequent Grafham Water. Between August and October many {migrants}are attracted to the reservoir such as Curlew, Sandpiper, Greenshank, Ruff, Knot and Little Stint. Such rarities as Temminck's Stint or Red necked Phalarope have also been recorded. Grafham Water has become acknowledged as one of the most important reservoirs for wintering wildfowl in England.
